reviews.text: Birthday dinner for my husband. Kelly was a great, food was great and cocktails were great. Highly recommend this gem for a special occasion!

We were warmly greeted and welcomed by Minmay, as well as by Nate, our server, both of whom provided excellent service. The pho was flavorful and well-prepared, while the pad see ew was slightly on the salty side for our Thai palate. Overall, however, the dining experience was delightful, and this restaurant is certainly worth a visit.
I tried pho with beef which is pretty tasty. And Met restaurant crew minmay and nate, they gave really good and friendly service.

Honestly, the pho is awful. The meat is stringy, the noodles are clumpy, and the broth isn't even hot enough to cook the bean sprouts. It's a passable meal, but I think there are better food options in the area, and better pho places in the city.
Make sure you go see Nicha at the bar! Sheâ€™s super kind, super sweet and makes the best drinks.
Food was fire:) and Nicha our bar tender  was the best and made us delicious drinks! Will definitely be back ğŸ’•â€¦
We had Boss, the PHO was amazing, papaya salad was on point and they helped make all of the modifications I needed. My husband had the tom yum. Very delicious will be coming back
Nate was great!
Tasty pho! ğŸœ Boss was an attentive and friendly server
Food is amazing, great location and Nate was an excellent guide through the menu. Please add Obao to your list of NY restaurants to try.
Boss is one amazing server. He made sure we were taken care of. The food is good and ambiance is great.

I haven't had a dining experience this great in a long time. The food was as inventive as it was amazing, a perfectly balanced mix of familiar and new - a flavor explosion. Spicy, sweet, tart, salty all worked together perfectly for each dish. Portions we're generous and and reasonably priced. Service was fast, even mildly entertaining, but not rushed. Modern, cozy decor. Loved it.
Wow food was delicious!!! We got the drunken noodles, com bo Luc lac and shrimp fried rice. It satisfied our Thai craving!! Our server Boss was super nice and attentive. I will definitely be back.
Our server Boss was great!
Boss was Great! Highly recommend

Our waiter Ken was very kind and attentive. However the food we got at this restaurant was mediocre. The pho chay we got had broth, fried tofu and two bean sprouts strings and no other vegetables. The vietnamese iced coffee was too sweet.
The food is really delicious and our server Boss is very nice

Excellent service, excellent food, beautiful ambiance! Kevin was a great, friendly server. I come here often and regularly bring my out of town guests.

Amazing Vietnamese cuisine restaurant! Bustling city vibe, GREAT staff! highly recommend the food. The manager, Mimi, and Kevin went above and beyond to make out experience excellent! Super friendly people. Canâ€™t wait to come back!
The food was so spicy that I only found comfort in steamed rice I ordered separately to be able to eat anything.
Takeaway way quick and delicious
Thanks Ken!
Absolutely amazing food!!! The food was delicious and authentic. Our server, Ken, is so friendly and attentive!!! Highly recommended ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ‘

Simply wonderful Vietnamese food, with humorous and attentive staff. Nate treated us so well, and the meal was spectacular. Pork belly sublime, as was the cashew chicken.

Will be coming back here the next time I work in New York!
The food, ambiance and service here is top notch!  We had Nate as our service who was super charismatic and playful!   We got thr shrimp Pad Thai, crispy cashew chicken and shrimp and pork bun!
Nate was the best server! Food was to die for, will be coming back
Excellent service and what a cool place.  Ribs are awesome.
Delicious Pho and Thai iced tea with a lovely atmosphere.
I had dinner and the food was delicious and reasonably priced. I will return and try different dishes.
Kelly is darling, and so very helpful!! Thus was our first time in, and she helped us choose our best options, limiting the excess sugar!

Kelly made our day by getting us the delicious desserts (coconut treasure & grilled banana), close to closing time. The Pho Chay was delicious (yay for vegetarian pho), as were the shrimp & chicken dumplings. It is a gorgeous restaurant too
Kelly was fabulous, she got us desserts well past closing time and made our meal even better! The food here is just fantastic, even for vegans!
Our server, Boss, was very attentive. Food was delicious and affordable with a good variety
First time trying Thai food and I had such great experience! Food was delicious and the service was excellent!
Boss was great !! Amazing food and service!
Superb food, fabulous ambience, and attentive but unobtrusive staff (our server, Boss, was excellent). Highly recommend.
If you like music and authentic Thai food. This is the place for you. Our server boss was amazing and very attentive. Canâ€™t wait to come back again!

I had a great experience! The food was fresh, flavorful, and authentic, and the drinks were just as impressiveâ€”perfectly made and refreshing. The atmosphere was cool. Definitely a spot Iâ€™d recommend and return to!

I came for dinner, I ordered steamed dumplings, Todd Man Goong ,Vietnamese Crispy pork belly is the best I ever had in NYC. Pho Bo with short ribs so so goood I recommend must try and donâ€™t forget to try Coconut Treasure dessert thatâ€™s perfect. The server name Ken, he is really nice also great service
It was great but a little loud . But good light food
Food low key took me off guard. V flavorful. Playlist is killer. Ken is solid.
Short rib was stelllllar
The service and food were amazing. Ken who was our servicer gave us the best experience
TrÃ¨s belle adresse, copieux et trÃ¨s bon ğŸ˜‹
Ken is the best!!
Food was great and Ken was helpful and attentive!

Solid Thai food at reasonable prices and good portions. Some elements were missing in the papaya salad that would have elevated it but the flavors were there. The shrimp and basil fried rice could do with more basil. The Khao Soi was a highlight with deep umami flavors. Ken was attentive and made sure were well looked after.
Great service

Amazing spot we stumbled upon!! Super friendly and quick service. Nate recommended the soup dumpling and summer roll- both were absolutely delicious! We order the pad thai which my partner loved! I ordered the yellow curry noodles with chicken. The flavor was amazing and the chicken was super tender. Great spot to stop by before a show! Nate made sure we were fully taken care of!

Good food and atmosphere! Our server, Nate, was excellent and made our meal so enjoyable! Would recommend the pork chops and the short rib massaman. Yummy Thai tea (mine was without dairy). A lovely meal in the city!

Very delicious food, still dreaming about that vegan pho we ordered 2 bowls of Vegan Pho plus the mushroom tacos! Everything was full of flavor and absolutely delicious. The brooth needs to be sold internationally and I might email you and ask you for the recipe. The atmosphere was clean and cozy, with great vibes and excellent service. I highly recommend! Itâ€™s a must stop in your NYC experience!!

I came here for dinner. They have a pretty good sized space for nyc and the prices are good as well. There's a bar as soon as you enter and stairs to go upstairs to more seating. Theres about 15 tables so definitely make reservations

I didn't really thjnk they were so different and outstanding compared to other viet restaurants but they offer good prices and service and are probably the best in the area. The jeeb dumplings were my favorite dish here.
The food was amazing!! The service was excellent, especially the bartender Nicha and Jak! They are friendly, kind and skilled with mixing drinks. The atmosphere and vibe was very chill and cute

Fantastic pre-broadway show dining experience. Fast, delicious, and Pete was great at helping us order quickly so we could do drinks, appetizers, and entrees and still get to our show on time. SO many great gluten free options and they had a happy hour until 6:30
